intro: Fernandezia serra, commonly known as the Serra fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Fernandezia serra typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
